page.title: 12HOUSING AND BUILDINGS 1
page.content: Farmhouses, many several hundred years old, built of local stone with flag, slate or tiled roofs, are the predominant form of housing. (Lower Core, Hough Clough and Bailey Hey were built of stone from the nearby quarry.) Older farmhouses tend to be Lancashire long houses - houses with barns attached. Working farms are generally owned by the occupants. All the houses have septic tank sanitation and mains water though, until about ten years ago, the farms at Bailey Hey and Watery Gate used spring water via a pump in the kitchen. There is no property for sale or rent at prices local young people could afford.
